page.title: 08EDUCATION (PART 1)
page.content: The first Church of England School in Hutton Henry was opened in 1871.It was an all age school and the children left at 14 years of age.The present school was opened in 1964.The first headmaster in the new building was Mr. Thompson and the present headteacher is Mrs.Jenkins. There are two classrooms and a hall, which is used as a classroom,a dining room and a gymnasium.There is also a kitchen and a staffroom.Outside there is a field and a playground.There are 23 Infants in Miss Ellis' classroom,14 Lower Juniors in Mrs.Jones'classroom and 16 Upper Juniors in the hall with Mrs. Joss.Also,there is a caretaker,a school clerk,a cook,a kichen maid and two supervisory assistants,who look after the children during lunch time.
